newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: CZECH PRAZDROJ Q1 BEER OUTPUT RISES.
newsitem.headline: CZECH PRAZDROJ Q1 BEER OUTPUT RISES.

text.p: Plzensky Prazdroj a.s., the largest Czech brewer, said on Friday its sales rose by 29.7 percent, year-on-year, in the first quarter to 884 million crowns.

Spokesman Jaroslav Pomp said production rose by 22.3 percent in the period, driven by both domestic sales and exports, which rose 17 percent in terms of volume. "It is a little higher than our plan expected," he said.
Prazdroj, based in the city of Plzen, mainly makes the lagers Pilsner Urquell and Gambrinus, the best-selling beer on the Czech market.
The brewery led producers with a 22 percent market share last year, in a country with the highest per capita beer consumption worldwide.
The company's net profit dipped to 75 million in 1996 from 158 million in 1995. It has said it planned to post a 125 million net profit this year on sales of 6.6 billion crowns.
Pomp did not reveal financial results for the period.
